DOC.brief_summary: The investigator conduct prospective , seven-month pilot study explore pharmacokinetic ( PK ) pharmacodynamic ( PD ) effect among woman epilepsy use levonorgestrel intrauterine system ( LNG IUS ) contraception . The investigator enroll twenty woman well-controlled epilepsy maintain stable anti-epileptic drug ( AED ) therapy seek LNG IUS contraception . The primary outcome AED level seizures LNG IUS placement . Secondary outcome include LNG level , evidence ovulation three week insertion ( serum progesterone > 3ng/ml ) , bleed spotting , endometrial thickness , continuation , satisfaction adverse event ( removal , expulsion , side effect ) . The investigator conduct baseline month assessment , insertion visit , follow-up visit 21 day , three month six month .
DOC.brief_title: Women With Epilepsy : Pilot Study PK PD Anti-epileptic Drug Effects Levonorgestrel Intrauterine System Users
